avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense snowfall fell in E-winds last week that drifted and formed wind slabs in W-facing hills. Beware of snow that has accumulated in gullies and depressions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It has snowed in E-winds the last days and windslabs and cornices have formed in W facing hills. There was not a lot of snow before the snowfall last week except high in the mountains but this older snow went through freeze-thaw cycles and is considered stable. Minor snowfall is expected in S-winds in the next days and warming on Thursday could temporarily destabilize the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last week. Most snowfall was in the North in N-winds at the start of last week that drifted into S-facing hills. During the weekend, some snow drifted back into N-facing hills in S-winds. A lot of snow also fell in E-winds in the southern region with windslabs and cornices forming in W-facing hills. Persistent weak layers have been found in the North and the Eastfjords. These layers have likely evolved in the frost but warming has started that could break down these layers. Instability could temporarily increase however during the warming episode.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last days. Persistent weak layers are present in the North and the Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður á þriðjudag. Á miðvikudag má búast við SV snjókomu til fjalla. Það hlýnar á fimmtudag og hvessir í SV átt með snjókomu til fjalla en slyddu og rigningu á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow arrived over the weekend and drifted in NE winds. More snow is forecasted, this time during SW-E winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow arrived over the weekend, and drifted during NE winds. More snow is forecasted on Wednesday during S/SW winds, so windslabs could form on northeasterly aspects. Unstable windslabs could have formed in gullies and depressions at high elevations. Thursday looks like temporary heavy snowfall during rather light easterly winds.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last week. Most snowfall was in the North in N-winds at the start of last week that drifted into S-facing hills. During the weekend, some snow drifted back into N-facing hills in S-winds. A lot of snow also fell in E-winds in the southern region with windslabs and cornices forming in W-facing hills. Persistent weak layers have been found in the North and the Eastfjords. These layers have likely evolved in the frost but warming has started that could break down these layers. Instability could temporarily increase however during the warming episode.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last days. Persistent weak layers are present in the North and the Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: S/SW-áttir að 15 m/s fram á fimmtudag en þá snýst í austanátt. Úrkomulítið á þriðjudag en á miðvikudag og fimmtudag bætir talsvert í snjó. Hlýnar örlítið á miðvikudag en áfram frost til fjalla. Kólnar aftur á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches have been falling in the region in various facies. Avalanche was reported from Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur in Karlsárdalur on Thursday that most likely fell on a weak layer boundary between old freeze-thaw snow and a windslab. On Friday, a large slab avalanche of size 2.5 fell in Burstabrekkudalur along with two smaller ones. On Sunday, another small avalanche fell in the same valley.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Between a layer of new and older snow is a weakness with faceting that formed in the recent frost episode. A lot of new snow fell last week in N winds along with driftsnow in S and NW winds later in the week. Thick, light windslabs could therefore be in variable facies on top of a weak layer.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow fell last week in N-winds but a lot has also drifted in S-winds during the weekend. NW snowfall has been ongoing now for the last 24 hours. A weakness can be found in the snowpack on the layer boundary between this new snow and older freeze-thaw snow. Windslabs could be present in various facies on top of this layer boundary. Snowpits from the region confirm that this weakness is caused by faceting in the layer boundary and stability tests showed a failure with low to medium load. Whumpfs and a remote triggered avalanche further confirm that this weak layer is widespread and the snowpack unstable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last week. Most snowfall was in the North in N-winds at the start of last week that drifted into S-facing hills. During the weekend, some snow drifted back into N-facing hills in S-winds. A lot of snow also fell in E-winds in the southern region with windslabs and cornices forming in W-facing hills. Persistent weak layers have been found in the North and the Eastfjords. These layers have likely evolved in the frost but warming has started that could break down these layers. Instability could temporarily increase however during the warming episode.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last days. Persistent weak layers are present in the North and the Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður á þriðjudag. Á miðvikudag má búast við SV snjókomu til fjalla. Það hlýnar á fimmtudag og hvessir í SV átt með snjókomu til fjalla en slyddu og rigningu á láglendi.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few sluffs occurred on Sunday. A few slab avalanches occurred in Eskifjörður, probably released during or after the snowfall on Jan 16.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New windslabs, that could be unstable, have formed on various aspects th recent days. A weak layer with facets has been found between the windslabs and underlying hardpacked snow. Warm weather and rain on Thursday could cause wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow arrived the night before Saturday, and drifted in E-winds. Before, recent windslabs had been formed in NW-erly winds on top of hardpacked snow. Between the windslabs and the hardpacked snow, a weak layer with facets has been found. Layered windslabs are expected on most aspects. Rising temperature and rain on Thursday could cause wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last week. Most snowfall was in the North in N-winds at the start of last week that drifted into S-facing hills. During the weekend, some snow drifted back into N-facing hills in S-winds. A lot of snow also fell in E-winds in the southern region with windslabs and cornices forming in W-facing hills. Persistent weak layers have been found in the North and the Eastfjords. These layers have likely evolved in the frost but warming has started that could break down these layers. Instability could temporarily increase however during the warming episode.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Windslabs have formed in most regions after snowfall and variable winds last days. Persistent weak layers are present in the North and the Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hægar breytilegar áttir og dálítil snjókoma á þriðjudag. Vaxandi suðlæg átt á miðvikudag, 10-18 m/s um kvöldið og hlýnar. Á fimmtudag er útlit fyrir allhvassa suðlæga átt með rigninguen líklega snjókomu hátt til fjalla.
